alert.note: Alert for Rapides; Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 5:15AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN RAPIDES...NORTHEASTERN BEAUREGARD...VERNON AND NORTH CENTRAL ALLEN PARISHES THROUGH 545 AM CST... At 514 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Leesville to 7 miles east of Rosepine. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leesville, Elizabeth, Hineston, Fort Polk, Pitkin, Sugartown, Slagle, New Llano, Lacamp, Fullerton, Hutton, Clifton, Flatwoods, Otis, Elmer, Leander, Sieper, Cravens, Calcasieu, and Simpson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
